key_points: Comedian Blaire Erskine responded to the Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp outage with a parody video.
Erskine posed as a Facebook spokesperson, humorously addressing users' reactions to the outage.
Her comments included mocking the #DeleteFacebook movement and the sudden outage, implying inconsistency from users.
Erskine also humorously lamented the absence of Tom from MySpace, joking about users missing his presence.
She concluded her video with a sarcastic remark about people forgetting their mom's birthdays without Facebook.
Erskine, who has joined the writing team for Jimmy Kimmel Live!, shared her conspiracy theory that Facebook intentionally caused the outage.
She humorously claims Facebook's outage was a 'petty power move' in response to the whistleblower's revelations and a way to assert dominance.
Erskine was not aware that Facebook was back online when she posted her video, playing into her joke about Facebook's control.
In the past, her parody videos have confused some high-profile figures, but she has yet to see prominent people mistake her latest video for reality.
Erskine expresses hope for a nod from "Tom from MySpace" regarding her parody.
